quest.name: A Parting Gift
journal: Sagar still seems to be worried about Berehta.
Despite her earlier enthusiasm, Berehta seems to be troubled once again. Sagar asks you to speak with her in the hopes of resolving whatever new problem has presented itself.

Berehta wishes to thank J'dyalani for keeping the date seeds safe all this time. Having never ventured far from Coldhearth, she says she would feel safer accompanied by an adventurer accustomed to braving the wilds of Gyr Abania. And so, the two of you set out together toward Ala Ghiri.
While passing through Mount Yorn, you and Berehta are assaulted by a group of chapulis. You promptly trounce them and check to see if Berehta is unharmed.
Berehta remains without injury, but is duly unsettled seeing such creatures firsthand. After regaining her composure, she presses onward.
Berehta stops for a moment to take in the sight of Specula Imperatoris before continuing onward. Hopefully there are no soldiers lingering in the shadows.
You walk through the abandoned base with Berehta, who is on pins and needles all the while. Knowing she is halfway to Ala Ghiri motivates her to continue.
Just when Ala Ghiri is within sight, you are attacked by wild griffins. You make quick work of them then check on your travel companion.
You are glad to see that Berehta is fine, albeit somewhat shaken. But the danger is over. Together you walk through the gates of Ala Ghiri.

You introduce Berehta to J'dyalani and the two soon find themselves lost in conversation like old friends. Baut happens to be passing by, taking the opportunity to seek your advice. Weidheri is in dire need of dates to produce arak, a type of spirit unique to the Gyr Abanian region. This problem is soon rectified when Baut suggests the people of Ala Ghiri and Coldhearth work together in cultivating the seeds Berehta recently received. He then escorts Berehta back to Coldhearth that he can better assess how much work there is to be done.
J'dyalani finds it miraculous how you bring people together. With this potential new source of dates for Ala Ghiri's trademark drink, the future has never looked brighter.

dialogue.name: SAGAR
dialogue.text: Oh, it's you. Thanks for helpin' with Berehta.

dialogue.name: SAGAR
dialogue.text: I was actually hopin' to talk to you about her. You see, she's been actin' strange again. She's always been stubborn about keepin' troubles to herself, but I'm sure she'd talk to you. Would you mind checkin' on her?

dialogue.name: SAGAR
dialogue.text: It'd mean a lot to me if you went and talked to her. I'm sure she's fine, but I worry about her, you know?

dialogue.name: BEREHTA
dialogue.text: <sigh> There's just too much work to go around. At this rate it'll take at least five years to─ah!

dialogue.name: BEREHTA
dialogue.text: Goodness, you scared me. What are you doin' here?

dialogue.name: BEREHTA
dialogue.text: Worried about me, are they? I keep tellin' them I'm fine, but they don't listen. Since you're here though, I could do with some help from a brave, young adventurer like yourself.

dialogue.name: BEREHTA
dialogue.text: I've been meanin' to thank J'dyalani for holdin' on to those seeds for us all that time, and I need someone to take me to Ala Ghiri.

dialogue.name: BEREHTA
dialogue.text: To be honest I've never traveled very far from Coldhearth. The others could take me, but I'd feel much safer in the company of someone used to bravin' the wilds. Are you up for takin' me on a little adventure?

dialogue.name: BEREHTA
dialogue.text: Glad to hear it. I doubt I'll be needin' any bags, so let's go ahead and get goin'.

dialogue.name: SAGAR
dialogue.text: A trip to Ala Ghiri? Well, I'll be. She's lived here in Coldhearth her whole life, you know. Wish I could've been the one to take her. Take good care of her, you hear?

dialogue.name: POPMESSAGE
dialogue.text: You are under attack!

dialogue.name: BEREHTA
dialogue.text: Are...are they gone? Goodness gracious. I'd heard stories of savage monsters out here, but to see them up close—I had no idea!

dialogue.name: BEREHTA
dialogue.text: I swear, if you weren't here, I'd be tellin' Erart about my first─and last─trip to Ala Ghiri right about now.

dialogue.name: BEREHTA
dialogue.text: Okay, I think I'm ready to keep goin'.

dialogue.name: BEREHTA
dialogue.text: Specula Imperatoris... Even from home I could always see that damned spire loomin' over everythin'.

dialogue.name: BEREHTA
dialogue.text: There was no goin' anywhere without the Garleans' say so. Not that I had anywhere to go, mind. Now that I finally do, though, I'm glad we're rid of them.

dialogue.name: BEREHTA
dialogue.text: I can't rightly say I've ever been so nervous walkin' through a big lot of nothin'. I was half expectin' one of them soldiers to jump out at me.

dialogue.name: BEREHTA
dialogue.text: And Erart was brave enough to pass through while they were still here. What was that boy thinkin'?

dialogue.name: BEREHTA
dialogue.text: In any case, we're halfway there. Hope my legs don't give out before then.

dialogue.name: BEREHTA
dialogue.text: Only a little further and─ahhh! Not again!

dialogue.name: BEREHTA
dialogue.text: I'm not sure how much more adventure my heart can take. Is it always so dangerous out here?

dialogue.name: BEREHTA
dialogue.text: I suppose it was worth it, though. You ever seen a town so beautiful?

dialogue.name: BEREHTA
dialogue.text: Cities ten times this size? How gullible do you think I am?

dialogue.name: BEREHTA
dialogue.text: Now, let's go and see this J'dyalani.

dialogue.name: BEREHTA
dialogue.text: So this is her? She seems like a sweet girl.

dialogue.name: SAGAR
dialogue.text: By that satisfied look on your face, I guess it's safe to say she made it to Ala Ghiri. I can only imagine what tall tales she'll have to tell when she gets back.

dialogue.name: JDYALANI
dialogue.text: Forename, good to see you. How is everything?

dialogue.name: JDYALANI
dialogue.text: The mother of that Skull soldier?

dialogue.name: BEREHTA
dialogue.text: Accordin' to my son's letter, I have you to thank for keepin' his gift safe all this time. Thought it only proper I come show my appreciation in person.

dialogue.name: BEREHTA
dialogue.text: Now we can finally put that barren soil of ours to some use.

dialogue.name: JDYALANI
dialogue.text: Think nothing of it. I'm just relieved to know it reached you safely.

dialogue.name: BAUT
dialogue.text: (-???-)Forename! What brings you back to Ala Ghiri?

dialogue.name: BAUT
dialogue.text: Thanks to Brazen Brook, and testimony from the good people here, I was pardoned by the Alliance leaders. They still keep me under close watch, of course. Can't say that I blame them. For now, Weidheri has been gracious enough to offer me room and board.

dialogue.name: BAUT
dialogue.text: Speaking of which, we've run into something of a problem. I was hoping to get your thoughts on the matter.

dialogue.name: BAUT
dialogue.text: Ala Ghiri was once famous for a particular type of spirit─arak. Sadly, the ingredients needed to make it have grown increasingly scarce.

dialogue.name: BAUT
dialogue.text: Stores of the stuff were promptly depleted when the Garleans took control here, but the soldiers were so taken with it, they began shipping in ingredients directly from Garlemald.

dialogue.name: BAUT
dialogue.text: Needless to say, when they left, so too did the supplies we need to make more.

dialogue.name: BAUT
dialogue.text: It would not do well for Ala Ghiri to be without its local specialty when trade begins booming again.

dialogue.name: BAUT
dialogue.text: We have searched everywhere, but all of the date palms native to this area have been cut down, and the soil is unfit for replanting. Do you know of any places where this plant still grows?

dialogue.name: BEREHTA
dialogue.text: Is somethin' the matter?

dialogue.name: BEREHTA
dialogue.text: They need dates for distillin' spirits? Now hold on a minute. We haven't even readied plots for plantin'.

dialogue.name: BEREHTA
dialogue.text: It'll take a lot of time and hands we don't even have.

dialogue.name: BAUT
dialogue.text: Perhaps we can make an arrangement. I'm certain the people of Ala Ghiri would be more than willing to help in exchange for a small share of the resulting produce.

dialogue.name: BAUT
dialogue.text: Might I accompany you home to better assess your situation?

dialogue.name: BEREHTA
dialogue.text: Why, of course! We can use all the help we can get.

dialogue.name: BEREHTA
dialogue.text: First the seeds, and now this. You're a miracle worker if there ever was one. I won't be forgettin' what you've done for us.

dialogue.name: BAUT
dialogue.text: You needn't worry, Forename. I will see to it no harm comes to her. Until next time.

dialogue.name: JDYALANI
dialogue.text: It still amazes me how you make good of even the most dire circumstances. There's no doubt Rhalgr smiles upon you.

dialogue.name: JDYALANI
dialogue.text: It will take a lot of work, to be sure, but in a few years' time traders from all over will be talking of the famous brew from Ala Ghiri and Coldhearth.

dialogue.name: JDYALANI
dialogue.text: I better get going. We'll need to be ready when Baut returns. Take care, Forename.
